title: What is the difference between intelligence, comon sense and wisdom? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a pragmatic nutshell… Intelligence Is the capacity to go from knowledge A to knowledge B without prior knowledge of any path from A to B (more to do with fluid intelligence).Don’t mistake it by education, which is the accumulated acquired knowledge (more to do with crystallized intelligence). Common sense The knowledge that is believed to be possessed by everybody. Basically a myth. “Works best” at the same cultural range. Wisdom The acquired knowing of the full extent of implications. Especially when the source of those implications seems simple truths and that are true in all levels of interpretation, both vertical and horizontal. The bigger the area of this vertical-horizontal (depth and extent) truth, the more wisdom.In other words, the knowledge about dense truths.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by V Jean Smith

response.answer_text: Intelligence is the ability to learn facts and skills. Wisdom is the ability to recognize what is good and use that knowledge to make life better for yourself and those around you. Common sense is the use of sound judgment in practical matters. Perhaps this will help: Intelligence is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put tomato in fruit salad.Common sense is not to trade a cow for a tomato.
